title: Drawing, "Competition Design for La Fenice, Venice: Longitudinal section of the Salon", 1788
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor, graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: In pen and black ink on rose colored lower margin, center: "SPACCATO DEL SALONE."; in lower right corner: "T.^IX"
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli (1845-1926), Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Longitudinal cross-section of the theater in shades of pink (showing structural supports), gray and yellow (roof). Large main chamber has ceiling with rounded, coved corners and a central balcony above a doorway. Right third of section shows six rooms, the top one with an arched door.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Competition Design for La Fenice, Venice: Longitudinal section of the Salon", 1788.
1788. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor, graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-122.
